Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of a copyright infringement lawsuit, suggesting that it will lead to the end of the entire "Battle Royale" game, when in fact, there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a hoax tweet that does not appear on Fortnite's official Twitter account. There is no official announcement from Epic Games about the termination of "Battle Royale."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the hoax tweet is true and presents it as a fact without verifying its authenticity.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides alternative explanations for the hoax tweet, suggesting that it was posted to mislead gamers during a time of server issues and a real copyright infringement lawsuit against a different studio.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Fortnite's official Twitter account has not made any announcement about the termination of "Battle Royale."
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting a hoax tweet as a legitimate source of information without verifying its accuracy.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
